channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Why flu cases are surging this season. And, protests erupt in Iran over the economy
item.description: The flu is spreading rapidly across the U.S. this season, and it is expected to get worse. And, protests have erupted across Iran over the country's troubled economy.
item.content:encoded:
The flu is spreading rapidly across the U.S. this season, and it is expected to get worse. And, protests have erupted across Iran over the country's troubled economy.

(Image credit: Quentin Top/Hans Lucas)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Out with the mayo: How Ukrainians reclaim holiday food
item.description: For many people from former Soviet countries, New Year's is a big holiday feast time. A Ukrainian restaurant in Washington gives NPR a taste of what's on the menu.
item.content:encoded:
For many people from former Soviet countries, New Year's is a big holiday feast time. A Ukrainian restaurant in Washington gives NPR a taste of what's on the menu.

(Image credit: Samantha Balaban/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: His brother's mental illness isolated his family. Now he's helping other caregivers
item.description: When it comes to serious mental illness, family caregivers are crucial partners. But often, they must fend for themselves. A new solution offers them support.
item.content:encoded:
When it comes to serious mental illness, family caregivers are crucial partners. But often, they must fend for themselves. A new solution offers them support.

(Image credit: Jos√© A. Alvarado Jr. for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Kat McGowan

item.title: Farmers are about to pay a lot more for health insurance
item.description: Tariffs, inflation, and other federal policies have battered U.S. farmers' bottom lines. Now many farmers say the expiration of federal health care subsidies will make their coverage unaffordable.
item.content:encoded:
Tariffs, inflation, and other federal policies have battered U.S. farmers' bottom lines. Now many farmers say the expiration of federal health care subsidies will make their coverage unaffordable.

(Image credit: Meghan Palmer)
item.dc:creator: Sarah Boden

item.title: Why do we make New Year's resolutions? A brief history of a long tradition
item.description: One of the earliest mentions of New Year's resolutions appeared in a Boston newspaper in 1813. But the practice itself can be traced back to the Babylonians.
item.content:encoded:
One of the earliest mentions of New Year's resolutions appeared in a Boston newspaper in 1813. But the practice itself can be traced back to the Babylonians.

(Image credit: Atsushi Tsukada)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: A little boy gave her hope for her foster daughter's future
item.description: At a neighborhood park, a young boy noticed Natalie's young foster daughter using a walker. His reaction left Natalie with an unexpected feeling of hope for the future.
item.content:encoded: At a neighborhood park, a young boy noticed Natalie's young foster daughter using a walker. His reaction left Natalie with an unexpected feeling of hope for the future.
item.dc:creator: Autumn Barnes

item.title: In one year, Trump pivots fentanyl response from public health to drug war
item.description: Experts say Biden's focus on addiction health care saved tens of thousands of lives and slowed fentanyl smuggling. Trump scrapped Biden's approach in favor of military strikes.
item.content:encoded:
Experts say Biden's focus on addiction health care saved tens of thousands of lives and slowed fentanyl smuggling. Trump scrapped Biden's approach in favor of military strikes.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump says the U.S. military conducted a strike on a Venezuelan dock he claims was used by drug smugglers, protests over economy flood Iran, flu cases in the U.S are on the rise, CDC data shows.
item.content:encoded: Trump says the U.S. military conducted a strike on a Venezuelan dock he claims was used by drug smugglers, protests over economy flood Iran, flu cases in the U.S are on the rise, CDC data shows.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: National Guard arrives in New Orleans for 1st New Year's since Bourbon Street attack
item.description: Nearly a year after a New Year's Day truck attack on Bourbon Street left 14 dead, New Orleans officials are still seeking permanent security solutions.
item.content:encoded:
Nearly a year after a New Year's Day truck attack on Bourbon Street left 14 dead, New Orleans officials are still seeking permanent security solutions.

(Image credit: Matthew Hinton/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: CIA behind strike at Venezuelan dock that Trump claims was used by drug smugglers, AP sources say
item.description: The CIA was behind a drone strike last week at a docking area believed to have been used by Venezuelan drug cartels. That's according to two people familiar with details of the operation.
item.content:encoded:
The CIA was behind a drone strike last week at a docking area believed to have been used by Venezuelan drug cartels. That's according to two people familiar with details of the operation.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
